intro: Panicum leucites, commonly known as silver panicum, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and delicate, feathery flower clusters. The plant typically grows in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soils contribute to its adaptability in various landscapes. The plant's unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
